title: The sad thing about playing Jungle
body: Everytime it's something negative it's always the junglers fault. I lost a game cause my dumbass mid got caught out and she starts blaming me for not giving her blue. Like wtf? It does not mean just cause you don't have blue you will get caught out. And there is no way I could have contested a 3 v 5 dragon and they start blaming me for not caring about dragon. What do I do then? Just go in 3 v 5 to contest a unsafe dragon? lmao

replies.body:
but it is the junglers fault,
 

Toplaner gave first blood? Junglers fault, entire team got aced in laning phase junglers fault, enemy reached level 2, junglers fault, Donald Trump got elected over Bernie sanders, Junglers fault, Hitler came back as an undead zombie to begin a third world war, junglers fault.

See the pattern?

Face it, some people will look for excuses as to why they didn't perform better and rarely blame themselves for their mistakes or when behind talk about what they could've done better,

as a support main I find it's more often blamed on the support. If top lane is losing I should be helping them.... but also not abandoning my adc. Also if I steal the enemy blue as zilean, the midlaner gets mad that i have a blue and they don't, since 'zilean doesn't need blue'.  I end up having to babysit everyone, ward everywhere even though sightstone has only 3 charges and vision ward can only have 1 up, I have to roam top, mid and help the jungler with their invades because they generally do this when they can't actually outfight the enemy jungler alone whilst also guaranteeing my adc has a good time otherwise they'll report me for being a bad sup even though they died 5 times the number of anyone else even though I revived them every time my ult was off cd. I do play jungle alot but I feel the support gets just as much blame.

Well personally I really couldn't blame any particular team mate unless they were really bad but that aside, 

More than often though they search for a reason they sucked and then try to pin it on the jungler for not ganking. If a jungler didn't gank a particular lane there might be a reason for that, he might be focusing farming or ganking other lanes depending on the state of the game. In fact people should play as if no there was no jungler on there team and learn to play from behind, to play safely. Yes if you get 4 man ganked you are pretty much screwed but you know what, those 4 men ganks mean there is now 2 other lanes where 4 people are not giving room for others to push so if you just stall them out you can secure an advantage for your team even if it means your death.

:P

Even if you fell behind in an uneven match up, a gank might not even turn your lane around it's important to figure out what you can do when the odds are not in your favour. 


And I certainly wouldn't blame you for even taking allied blue since ZIlean is a very inefficient mana machine. 

Earlier I was playing with a Zilean support( I used to main ZIlean) who wasn't really up to scratch with landing his stun or his ult correctly but I wasn't gonna rage because well for one it was normals and I realize that even if Zilean's choice in champion left him unable to peel for me I realize that my own decision making could've been better as well. I died quite a bit in that game but I focused on farming and catching out target when I could, knowing that Zilean's stun is at times utterly unreliable.

The same goes for a fed champion, you don't go to 1v1 a fed laner because that is just dumb in retrospect unless you're one of those CC heavy burst champions like Jax or Irelia. You instead adapt and try to apply yourself to the current situation. Blaming people for feeding does nothing,  instead it's better to spend time thinking about what you can do to turn it around and what are your options.

I don't think that zilean was me because the worst score I have ever had with zilean was 6-8-4 and we got utterly decimated that match with like 14-40 or something like that. Also zileans has great peel and provides alot of damage as most mage supports do. 

Also I took the enemy blue, NOT our blue, the ENEMY blue from the enemy jungler and then ran away spamming my laugh. As a support I feel you should never take buffs, but enemy buffs are fairgame if you can steal them.

Why do people pick on you for stealing enemy buffs? Isn't it a good thing? The jungle is supposed to steal buffs but who says the support can't qwq the enemy jungler's buff before they smite it?

Zilean's peel is crap against anything that has a gap closer relative to other supports and he doesn't provide consistent damage due to how easy it is to avoid Zilean's bombs unlike other mage supports, don't even get me started on Yasuo match ups.  Not to say he doesn't have strengths. 

Also i know it wasn't your side blue buff I was just saying I wouldn't have cared if it was our own buff.  

Yeah it's kind of pointless.

his bombs aren't that easy to avoid if the zilean knows what he's doing. He's got good range and often it's easier to qwq a minion or ally than go for an enemy even if it pushes the wave a little if you need some desperate peel. I don't know; zilean has always felt reliable for me and his bomb poke is really hard to avoid if he's played botlane. Always remember to aa harass since he has a great aa animation and a range to match most adcs; it doesn't do much damage on the face of it but it quickly adds up to alot of harass in lane. Your damage to enemy champions bar at the end of the game with a utility build should be 30% physical, 70% magic damage and you should always push under tower if the enemy and your adc backs since you push hard and fast and you need early gold to get a tear and sightstone,

IMO only an amateur zilean will use his qwq every time since this burns alot of mana and should only be used to lockdown enemies for the kill or to peel. By using one q at a time when trading, you conserve alot of mana which he doesn't have much of and if they suddenly turn around on you, you can more reliably get the stun off since they will be focused on the attack and won't have time to dodge it. I see soo many zileans use the e immediately as soon as they stun but in actuality you should wait till they're just about to come out of stun for an almost inescapable perma slow-stun lockdown. 

These are just some of many things I've noticed when I play zilean compared to other zileans and first timers (I'm still learning and I've yet to try ranked with him, I'm bronze 5 atm and if he stops getting banned by my team I will try to use him to climb, since I've yet to do bad with him and I get S- or higher in 80% of my zilean games). He's simple so all these other things can make him alot stronger and are easier to focus on. I feel his utility is much better than his damage atm and he's best built full cdr and put botlane as a sup. Also his revive on that 32s cooldown makes it one of the strongest, funniest and easiest to use ults in the game if used right.

I friggin love playing zilean atm since compared to all the other champions, he's the only one where I consistently do great (though I'm pretty decent at most supports for my elo) and he has a huge impact on low elo games. He has alot of map pressure, he can splitpush hilariously, he's got some massive cc if you can pull it off and he can offer amazing support if anyone on your team gets ahead. He also helps me focus on micromanagement of skills and since his kit is so simple.

Zilean was the first champion I fell in love with and mained when I started playing Lol. His micromanagement skills are fantastic on a level but at the same time he falls short in some areas where others excel. I can't blind pick Zilean into a ranked game. 

I know I'm gonna sound like a meta drone or whatever but with the current state of a game Zilean is a hit or miss at least for me. Zilean can and does work especially in the hands of someone who can use his abilities to the full extent of their utility. 

However when the enemy picks tier 1 supports namely, Sona, Alistar, Blitzcrank, Leona, Nautilus, or even Morghana Zilean begins to struggle if they are competent at those champions. Why? Because Zilean isn't mobile or doesn't put out CC as consistently. How about Fizz, Ekko, Talon, Ahri, or Malzahar being picked into the mid lane so that when laning phase ends, life gets a lot more difficult for Zilean. These aren't the only ones btw but the reason I bring them up is not because of FOTM but the fact that I see them a lot and are common picks into those lanes.

Personally would only pick Zilean mid if the enemy laner and jungler have already locked in because it only takes one second for them to make a decision to camp out in mid or the enemy support making a counter pick for Zilean like Lee sin or hecarim.

Imo Sona and Blitzcrank don't counter zilean as much as it would seem because most of what he does is stunlockdown and long range harass in lane, though a good leona, alistair can counter you hard. Morgana+Sivir botlane makes you next to useless and I don't feel with the meta that taking zilean mid would be a good idea...
Zilean's stuns should be consistent otherwise he's not a good zilean though and leesin is only a counter if the leesin can insec and is not bronze. I want to play zilean in ranked since he's by and large the champion I'm best at but nobody lets me... or the enemy has a morgana, leona, nautilus, sivir, kalista, caitlynn, shaco, talon, hecarim... there is a pretty long list and then I'm like nope this ain't gonna work.

Yah, my point is dat Zilean can work but there's so many specific counterpicks that are very popular in the current meta that may not directly counter Zilean but do things ZIlean can't really beat or overcome. 

I listed Lee sin because he possesses the feature ZIlean is specifically weak against and that's mobility and burst. Zilean is also weak against poke lanes since he has no sustain against enemies and lacks the range to deal damage against the likes of a Vel'koz or Ezreal.

The issue with ZIlean's stun is that he has to land not one but two skill shots which are basically ground targeted that have to land directly on top of one another. Granted there are tricks around this such as using it on a minion or using your slow to  control the enemy to make them easier to bomb but against mobile enemies it's very hard to land such as ezreal and lucian. whereas linear skill shots are far more effective and reliable and controlling one target if that makes sense. 

Yasuo whose a very common mid and top pick nowadays simply having his presence in the enemy team can negate your damage as zilean as a whole.
my cheesiest strat in low elo as a support (not zilean but say soraka or lulu)  is to steal the enemy jungler's first blue. It screws them over soo much and gives me the mana to dominate the lane.

It's always support and jungler receiving all the shit and NEVER get credited for doing a extraordinary job at doing something. Like once I stole baron twice and when we lost they blamed me for not being good enough like wtf

or when you steal the baron as a soraka with a e-q when the rest of your team was aced, and then the garen that just spawned tp's in (after you already got the baron) and tries to 5v1 and dies and it's your fault for not flashing over the wall to help fight with him and your team just keeps flaming you.
Hard. When they make stupid decisions and they blame you for it.

As someone who's been playing a lot of Shyvana lately (both Top and Jungle), it's important for people to recognise that if there's no CC coming from the Jungler, there needs to be CC coming from the Laner. If neither party can provide CC, then a gank is going to be pretty damn hard to pull off. If this is the case, quite simply understand that you won't be receiving many, if any, ganks and that you'll have to either win the lane yourself, or simply keep your tower up as long as possible and scrape together as much cs as you can without giving away kills.

I feel that's mostly true but some junglers are all cc, like amumu and so if amumu ganks you need to provide the damage. When a gank occurs you need 4 things generally:  cc, damage, resources and position. The jungler only needs to provide some extra damage and maybe some cc if they have it. Otherwise it's hard to gank.
I play jungle Lee Sin alot and your team wants you to gank them when they are pushed out hardcore.

haha they want them insecs. Yeah that's sounds pretty bad. I mean if a leesin doesn't try to go all balls to the walls mechanics and understands his limits he's still decent even if the player isn't a high elo m7 leesin only main. 
The problem is people who expect all leesins to pull off an insec; oh the bronze tryhards love it but I can completely empathise with how hard the pressure if when you want to play leesin but you understand your limits and people still expect you to make big plays.

Hard. Like I know if I land a Q on the enemy tristana and I engage she would simply jump away and I would get fucked by the rest of the enemy team. Yet my adc tells me why I never go on the tristana lol

Your great, it is really important to not fall behind even as a jungler or else your ganks will not be effective and you won't be able to contest for dragon.  really not sure why your mid lane was mad for since he/she wasn't able to keep calm and farm safely without overpushing and feed.
cause she was asking for ganks but I could not gank cause she was pushing her lane out

If she is pushing her lane out to far for you to be able to gank then just farm, don't waste time doing nothing/wating for the lane to push back. If this happens again in another game then have the laner let them push (make sure to have pink/lens incase theres a ward) and gank the lane when your able. If the mid laner have some sort of snare, taunt or root then have them start off with that and go in. (save any ability to close in on your enemy if they have flash). So yeah it ain't your fault when mid lane is losing.
It's just sad how people blame
Yeah, its often people have no self-control so they just completely lose it even after 1 death and tilt themselves
Low Elo Problems.

When it's like five mins into a game and you are like lvl 3/4 and every lane is asking for a gank and then they start blaming there loss in lane because we didn't gank at 5 minutes. When they could've just played safer until i get lvl 5-6. I mean like you sometimes gank at 5 mins but usually it's only when they are pushed up but most of the time they ask for tanks when they are pushed into there tower
Even better is when they are pushed into tower by someone like leblanc and begging you to gank while your level 3/4 and your just sitting there like, what the fuck do you expect me to do here?

In blind pick

>Picks Udyr as jungle,
>midlaner begs for a gank on Leblanc mid
>Me:...

Junglers are the swing players of the game. A great JG will literally win the game for his team... early-mid that is (which often prevents there ever being a late game)

I think it is the most demanding role, the one requiring the most skill as well as the most maturity and experience. 

You have to win your own "lane" while enabling your team mates to win theirs.
One time i was a xin zhao no smite jg and i just got my team sooo fed early that we won even though i was behind on xp and everything  probs my best jg game even though i was so far behind

Dude I got my adc and top fed but mid was pushed out so I couldn't gank that much. Late game came and my mid laner got caught out since she was frontline and then she starts blaming me on why she got caught out etc.

Don't worry, i just had a top laner complain at me for him dying twice within 5 minutes to "diving"

Decided to watch the replay, he got "dove" cause he was staying under tower at 200 health after getting poked out, while i was bot side getting our jinx fed.

And by dove, the Aatrox took one tower shot to finish him off.
and then he starts blaming you like wtf

Unless it's going to be a guaranteed kill or at least burn their Flash + Force them to back I just power farm Level 6, go bot, kill, chunk/take tower, rotate mid/dragon and force teamfights earlier than the enemy team can handle it.

Honestly, just let your jungler lead the team and keenly await their engages.

90% of my losses are caused by people playing lane phase irresponsibly, or an egotistical prick throwing the game off a bad engage that they forced.
I try and lead and instead of taking objectives most of the time my team chases a support through their jungle lmao
Welcome to league of legends
The pain of jungling :\
